fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper

Class SessionBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.AbstractParent<CloudhopperBuilder>
      • fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper.SessionBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.Builder<CloudhopperSessionOptions>, fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.Parent<CloudhopperBuilder>

    public class SessionBuilder
extends fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.AbstractParent<CloudhopperBuilder>
implements fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.Builder<CloudhopperSessionOptions>
    Configures Cloudhopper session management (timeouts, retry, session name...).
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Constructor Detail

      • SessionBuilder

        public SessionBuilder(CloudhopperBuilder parent,
                      fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.env.EnvironmentBuilder<?> environmentBuilder)
        Initializes the builder with a parent builder. The parent builder is used when calling AbstractParent.and() method. The EnvironmentBuilder is used to evaluate properties when build() method is called.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent builder
        environmentBuilder - the configuration for property resolution and evaluation

    • Method Detail

      • sessionName

        public SessionBuilder sessionName(String... sessionName)
        A name for the session (used to name threads). You can specify a direct value. For example: 
         .sessionName("foo");

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .sessionName("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        sessionName - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • bindTimeout

        public SessionBuilder bindTimeout(Long timeout)
        Set the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait for the success of a bind attempt to the SMSC. Defaults to 5000. This value preempts any other value defined by calling bindTimeout(String...) method. If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum amount of time to wait (in ms)
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • connectRetry

        public fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.retry.RetryBuilder<SessionBuilder> connectRetry()
        Configures how to handle a connection that fails. You can configure if retry should be done when a connection to the server couldn't be established. The builder lets you define the retry behavior. For now, only a FixedDelayRetry is handled. The FixedDelayRetry needs a delay between two tries and a maximum attempts. In the future, we could handle different strategies if needed like retrying with an exponential delay for example. If you don't configure it, no retry is applied at all.
        Returns:
        the builder to configure the retry handling

      • requestExpiryTimeout

        public SessionBuilder requestExpiryTimeout(Long timeout)
        Set the amount of time (milliseconds) to wait for an endpoint to respond to a request before it expires. Defaults to disabled (-1). This value preempts any other value defined by calling requestExpiryTimeout(String...) method. If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum amount of time to wait (in ms) before an unacknowledged request expires. -1 disables.
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • requestExpiryTimeout

        public SessionBuilder requestExpiryTimeout(String... timeout)
        Set the amount of time (milliseconds) to wait for an endpoint to respond to a request before it expires. Defaults to disabled (-1). You can specify a direct value. For example: 
         .requestExpiryTimeout("-1");

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .requestExpiryTimeout("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        timeout - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • windowMonitorInterval

        public SessionBuilder windowMonitorInterval(Long interval)
        Sets the amount of time (milliseconds) between executions of monitoring the window for requests that expire. It's recommended that this generally either matches or is half the value of requestExpiryTimeout. Therefore, at worst a request would could take up 1.5X the requestExpiryTimeout to clear out. Defaults to -1 (disabled). This value preempts any other value defined by calling windowMonitorInterval(String...) method. If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.
        Parameters:
        interval - The maximum amount of time to wait (in ms) between executions of monitoring the window.
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • windowMonitorInterval

        public SessionBuilder windowMonitorInterval(String... interval)
        Sets the amount of time (milliseconds) between executions of monitoring the window for requests that expire. It's recommended that this generally either matches or is half the value of requestExpiryTimeout. Therefore, at worst a request would could take up 1.5X the requestExpiryTimeout to clear out. Defaults to -1 (disabled). You can specify a direct value. For example: 
         .windowMonitorInterval("-1");

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .windowMonitorInterval("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.

        this instance for fluent chaining

      • windowSize

        public SessionBuilder windowSize(Integer size)
        Sets the maximum number of requests permitted to be outstanding (unacknowledged) at a given time. Must be > 0. Defaults to 1. This value preempts any other value defined by calling windowSize(String...) method. If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.
        Parameters:
        size - The maximum number of requests
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • windowSize

        public SessionBuilder windowSize(String... size)
        Sets the maximum number of requests permitted to be outstanding (unacknowledged) at a given time. Must be > 0. Defaults to 1. You can specify a direct value. For example: 
         .windowSize("1");

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .windowSize("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called.       • windowWait

        public SessionBuilder windowWait(Long timeout)
        Set the amount of time (milliseconds) to wait until a slot opens up in the sendWindow. Defaults to 60000. This value preempts any other value defined by calling windowWait(String...) method. If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum amount of time to wait (in ms) until a slot in the sendWindow becomes available.
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • writeTimeout

        public SessionBuilder writeTimeout(Long timeout)
        Set the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait for bytes to be written when creating a new SMPP session. Defaults to 0 (no timeout, for backwards compatibility). This value preempts any other value defined by calling writeTimeout(String...) method. If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum amount of time to wait (in ms)
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • writeTimeout

        public SessionBuilder writeTimeout(String... timeout)
        Set the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait for bytes to be written when creating a new SMPP session. Defaults to 0 (no timeout, for backwards compatibility). You can specify a direct value. For example: 
         .writeTimeout("0");

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .writeTimeout("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        timeout - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • responseTimeout

        public SessionBuilder responseTimeout(Long timeout)
        Set the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait until a valid response is received when a "submit" request is synchronously sends to the remote endpoint. The timeout value includes both waiting for a "window" slot, the time it takes to transmit the actual bytes on the socket, and for the remote endpoint to send a response back. Defaults to 5000. This value preempts any other value defined by calling requestExpiryTimeout(String...) method. If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum amount of time to wait (in ms)
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • responseTimeout

        public SessionBuilder responseTimeout(String... timeout)
        Set the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait until a valid response is received when a "submit" request is synchronously sends to the remote endpoint. The timeout value includes both waiting for a "window" slot, the time it takes to transmit the actual bytes on the socket, and for the remote endpoint to send a response back. Defaults to 5000. You can specify a direct value. For example: 
         .responseTimeout("5000");

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .responseTimeout("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        timeout - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • unbindTimeout

        public SessionBuilder unbindTimeout(Long timeout)
        Set the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait until the session is unbounded, waiting up to a specified period of milliseconds for an unbind response from the remote endpoint. Regardless of whether a proper unbind response was received, the socket/channel is closed. Defaults to 5000. This value preempts any other value defined by calling unbindTimeout(String...) method. If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum amount of time to wait (in ms)
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • unbindTimeout

        public SessionBuilder unbindTimeout(String... timeout)
        Set the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait until the session is unbounded, waiting up to a specified period of milliseconds for an unbind response from the remote endpoint. Regardless of whether a proper unbind response was received, the socket/channel is closed. Defaults to 5000. You can specify a direct value. For example: 
         .unbindTimeout("5000");

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .unbindTimeout("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        timeout - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • keepSession

        public SessionBuilder keepSession(boolean keepSessionOpen)
        Keep the previous session open instead of closing and reopening one.
        Parameters:
        keepSessionOpen - true to reuse the same session for every sent SMS, false to close the previous session after the SMS has been sent
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
